contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=October 2011}} {{nihongo|'''Mattō'''|松任市|Mattō-shi}} was a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Ishikawa Prefecture]], Japan. In 2003, the city had an estimated [[population]] of 66,520 and a [[population density]] of 1,109.96 persons per km². The total area was 59.93 km². The city was founded on October 10, 1970.<ref name=hokkoku>{{cite web|title=野々市町5万人達成 11月市制施行|url=http://www.hokkoku.co.jp/subpage/H20110215103.htm|work=Hokkoku Shimbun website|publisher=Hokkoku Shimbun|accessdate=6 September 2011|language=Japanese}}</ref> On February 1, 2005 Mattō was merged with the towns of [[Mikawa, Ishikawa|Mikawa]] and [[Tsurugi, Ishikawa|Tsurugi]], and the villages of [[Kawachi, Ishikawa|Kawachi]], [[Oguchi, Ishikawa|Oguchi]], [[Shiramine, Ishikawa|Shiramine]], [[Torigoe, Ishikawa|Torigoe]] and [[Yoshinodani, Ishikawa|Yoshinodani]], all from [[Ishikawa District, Ishikawa|Ishikawa District]], to create the new city of [[Hakusan, Ishikawa|Hakusan]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Ishikawa}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Matto, Ishikawa}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Ishikawa Prefecture]] {{Ishikawa-geo-stub}}
